Package StatsLibrary

Class StatsLibrary

java.lang.Object
StatsLibrary.StatsLibrary
public class StatsLibrary extends Object
This class provides a collection of statistical and probability functions.

  • Method Details

    • uniformDistributionProbability

      public double uniformDistributionProbability(double a, double b, double c, double d)
      Calculates the probability of a uniform distribution within the range [a, b] for a given sub-interval [c, d].
      Parameters:
      a - The lower bound of the entire distribution.
      b - The upper bound of the entire distribution.
      c - The lower bound of the sub-interval for which the probability is calculated.
      d - The upper bound of the sub-interval for which the probability is calculated.
      Returns:
      The probability of the uniform distribution within the specified sub-interval.

    • uniformDistributionExpectedValue

      public double uniformDistributionExpectedValue(double thetaSubOne, double thetaSubTwo)
      Calculates the expected value of a uniform distribution with given bounds.
      Parameters:
      thetaSubOne - The lower bound of the uniform distribution.
      thetaSubTwo - The upper bound of the uniform distribution.
      Returns:
      The expected value of the uniform distribution.

    • uniformDistributionVariance

      public double uniformDistributionVariance(double a, double b)
      Calculates the variance of a uniform distribution with given bounds.
      Parameters:
      a - The lower bound of the uniform distribution.
      b - The upper bound of the uniform distribution.
      Returns:
      The variance of the uniform distribution.

    • jointProbabilityIndependence

      public String jointProbabilityIndependence(double pXOfX, double pYOfY, double pXAndY)
      Determines the joint probability independence based on marginal probabilities.

      This method takes the marginal probabilities pXOfX, pYOfY, and the joint probability pXAndY as parameters and determines whether the marginal probability functions p_x (x) and p_y (y) are independent or dependent.

      Parameters:
      pXOfX - The marginal probability function p_x (x).
      pYOfY - The marginal probability function p_y (y).
      pXAndY - The joint probability function p(x, y).
      Returns:
      A String indicating the independence or dependence of the marginal probability functions.
